messages.subject: CAN YOU BE HONEST?
messages.body:
Fri, 09 Sep 2005


MIME-Version: 1.0 >X-Sender: 196.201.74.239 
Received: from xnmsrelay1.terra.com ()

FROM:FELIX DUNGA 
Abidjan,Republic of Cote d'ivoire.

GOOD DAY

Good a thing to write you. I have a proposal for you-this however is not mandatory nor will I in any manner compel you to honour against your will.

I am FELIX DUNGA .22years old and the only Son of my late parents Mr.and Mrs.dunga My father was a highly reputable busnness magnet-(a cocoa merchant)who operated in the capital of Ivory coast during his days. It is sad to say that he passed away mysteriously in France during one of his business trips abroad year 12th.Febuary 2003.Though his sudden death was linked or rather suspected to have been masterminded by an uncle of his who travelled with him at that time.

But God knows the truth!

My mother died when I was just 8 years old,and since then my father took me so special. Before his death on Febuary 12 2003 he called the secretary who accompanied him to the hospital and told him that he has the sum of Ten million,seven hundred thousand United State Dollars.(USD$10.700,000) left in fixed deposit account in one of the leading banks in Africa. He further told him that he deposited the money in my name,and finally issued a written instruction to his lawyer whom he said is in possession of all the necessary but legal documents to this fund and the bank.

I am just 22 years old and a university undergraduate and really don't know what to do.Now I want an account overseas where I can transfer this funds. This is because I have suffered a lot of set backs as a result of incessant political crisis here in Ivory coast.The death of my father actually brought sorrow to my life. I am in a sincere desire of your humble assistance in this regards.Your suggestions and ideas will be highly regarded.

Now permit me to ask these few questions:- 
1. Can you honestly help me as your son? 
2. Can I completely trust you? 
3. What percentage of the total amount in question will be good for you after the money is in your account?

Please,Consider this and get back to me as soon as possible.

Thank you so much. 
My sincere regards. 
Felix Dunga

messages.body:
September 13, 2005

Felix, my son,

I have looked deep into my heart and have seen the light. I cannot turn my back on you in your time of need and loss.

I should tell you a little bit about myself. I am an international hotel consultant and I am currently consulting to a small resort hotel here in the remote village of Gadyukina, Russia. I enjoy my work very much, mostly due to the interesting people I meet. Should you need to contact me the number here at the hotel is ¥ (095) 964-8597.

I am not married but I am dating a beautiful young lady who works here at the hotel, Olga, the east German massage therapist. If you do decide to come here, she has a younger sister who you might like to get to know.

We need to establish a chain of command at the very outset. I am a successful businessman and I'm sure we can solve your problem and move your money with very little effort. With your limited knowledge of these matters I need you to closely follow my advice. Do not do anything without asking me first. Do this, and we can probably have you and your money here by the middle of next month.

Now, to start things off, what kind of documentation do you have for this account? Anything you have, no matter how unimportant it seems, should be scanned and sent to me immediately. The hotel fax machine has been out of order for the past two months and the new one has not yet arrived from Murmansk so you'll have to scan and send as email attachments.

I don't want you talking to any bankers yet. It has been my experience that most bankers, as well as lawyers, are shameless thieves. We'll contact them when we need them.

I look forward to hearing from you again. By the way, my friends call me Lewd (short for Lewis D.), but you can call me................. Dad.

Dad

messages.body:
September 15, 2005

Filix,

So good to hear from you.

We need to have a talk about a couple of things. First things first.

Felix, you're 22 years old, right? I am somewhat distressed to hear that a boy your age spends all his time with his pastor praying and seeking spiritual advice. This is WRONG, my son. A kid your age needs to be out chasing the girls, partying a little, enjoying his youth while he still has it. If you should decide to come here to live under my care, I don't want you hanging around some church all the time, I want you out raising hell, getting your girlfriend in trouble, that sort of thing.

I think I have just the cure for you. I thnk I mentioned that I date a woman who works here at the hotel as a massage therapist. Her name is Olga, she's an Anna Kornikova look-alike except for being six inches shorter and 200 lbs heavier. She has a younger sister named Oxnard who just happens to be single. Oxnard is a bit stockier than Olga but she's big-boned and carries it well. You two would probably hit it off great, assuming you don't have any kind of heart condition and can't handle heavy excercise. We'll talk about this some more later.

I received the scanned copy of the deposit certificate and it looks like we have a problem on our hands. You told me in your first letter that your father deposited the money to an account in your name, right? I don't see your name anywhere on the document. In fact, the only name on the certificate is 'Michael Dunga'. Please send me the documentation on this account showing that it's in your name.

Please get back to me on this as quickly as possible.

Lewd

messages.body:
September 18, 2005

Felix,

I'm sorry it took me so long to get back to you but I wanted to take the weekend to think about this.

I'm afraid that I'm going to have to excuse myself from this transaction and I want to be absolutely honest with you about my reasons for doing so.

Felix, if you came here to live I don't think you and I would get along very well. No offense, but I can't be having a kid your age sitting around the house praying all the time. It would take about 15 minutes of that for me to be bouncing off the walls. Like I told you before, it ain't normal for a young guy like you to be hanging out with pastors and meditating and praying all day. No, you should be out laying siege to every girl in the neighborhood, wrecking your car once in awhile, getting drunk, getting in fights, stuff like that. That's what normal, well-adjusted kids do.

You said you wanted to find yourself as a man, but you appear to be chemically free of interest towards women. How you gonna become a man without women, and lots of them? Olga's younger sister Oxnard could have got you started off on the right foot. That girl is 275 pound of uninhibited lust and she was very excited when I told her there was every chance you would be coming here.

I'm really sorry to have to tell you this because I think I could have helped you get this transaction finished quickly. I realize we're talking about a lot of money here but my main reason for getting involved was to help a young kid get a proper start in life, which you don't seem to want.

I'm sure you can easily find someone else to help you with this. By all means, stay in touch and let me know how you're doing.

Take care, 
Lewd

Felix,

I'm glad to see that you considered my advice and came to the only logical conclusion. It shows me that you're a bright lad, able to think on his feet. Trust Uncle Lewd to show you the TRUE path.

That said, I talked to Oxnard, told her that it looks like you'll be joining us after all, and she is ecstatic! I've never seen her this excited about anything before! From the desk of Dr. Paul Petters, the Remittance Depart. Director, 
BIAO BANK, Abidjan - CI. 
Attn: Our Valued Customers. Mr. Noogie, of Latvia

Sir,

RE: SWIFT KTT TRANSFER OF US$ 10.7 MILLION INTO THE MULTIBANKA, ESTONIA BRANCH, LATVIA. SWIFT CODE # MULTLV3Y, ACCT. N¥# 100205523202. BENEFICIARY: DLN ASSOCIATES LLC.

Sequel, to your official request to our Bank through your local partner here Felix Dunga concerning the transfer of your funds to your nominated account, we hereby stated the following informations and advise regarding to your request. It is our banking regulation you identify your self legally as the beneficiary of the said deposit fund under our custody for the past years.

These are our rules and regulation, that before such huge mount of money will be transferred out of cote d'Ivoire, an attorney must swear an Affidavit of Oath,legalised and notarised and normalised all documents related to the transfer, with an Approval from Ministry of Finance Cote d'Ivoire for Exchange Approval Including change of ownership, to enable us remove a clause attached by your late partner during the time of deposit.

After he/ she has fully identify himself as the bonafide beneficiary of the fund,every dealings of this transfer will be forwarded straight to the beneficiary as you are the only identity we know.

Therefore, you are advised to contact immediately our accredited attorney here in Abidjan - Ivory Coast for the legalisation of your funds transfer related documents so that we can de-block your funds and effect your transfer.

You need to contact an accredited attorney, Barrister Clifford Amoise, on this email address or phone numbers for his legal advise and assistance towards notarising, normalising and legalising of your transfer related documents.
Contact person : Barrister Clifford Amoise, Principal Attorney of the Equity Chambers. 
E-mail: ( cliffordamoise@equitychambersci.com) 
tel + 225 05 77 3412.

We await your prompt attention.

Management, 
Dr. Paul Petters. Director Foreign Remittance Department. 
BIAO - BANK, Abidjan -CI.

Ok, Felix, here's the deal.

As I mentioned to you earlier, Gadyukina is a small village and there is no Western Union here. Ms. Bushburn, my Administrative Assistant, will be driving to Irkutsk on Sunday morning. There is a Western Union there and she can send the money to this diplomat early Monday.

However, since this little venture has cost and is continuing to cost me money, I want to be very certain that I'm getting my money's worth. I told you from the very beginning that I could not have you coming here and spending all your time with pastors and praying and stuff. You assured me that you had changed your lifestyle and had taken up smoking, drinking, and chasing girls. I asked for a picture of you holding a can of beer and smoking, which you never sent. If I'm going to have to pay all this money I want that picture, but now I want one of you holding a cigarette (or cigar), a can (or bottle) of beer, and a girl on your lap.

You see, Felix, I have to be absolutely certain that you have changed, and I'm not willing to take your word for it. I'm very serious about this. If I'm going to be taking care of you I want someone who lives my healthy lifestyle. The percentage of this money you offered me will be very useful but I make enough money already to be comfortable. I very much want to help you get a good start in life but I have to know I have the right material to work with.

Send me the picture and Maya (Ms. Bushburn) will leave for the Irkutsk Western Union office with the money for the diplomat. If you're still not willing to do this then I again offer my original suggestion - find someone else to help you. This is not negotiable.

I hope you'll see things my way so we can get you here quickly.

messages.body:
December 13, 2005

Ms. Graham,

I will address each of your comments:

1. My international passport / drivers licence - I make it a practice never to send these through email. I should point out that you are making a transfer to an account provided to you by Mr. Dunga so I see no reason why your having a copy of these documents would be necesary.

2. My attendance in Belgium to sign clearance documents - I am receiving the funds in your possession, not sending them. Common banking procedures dictate that Mr. Dunga would be responsible for signing any clearance documents. If he has not already done so I would suggest you send them to him for signature.

3. The necessity for me to open a 'non-resident' account with your correspondent bank - Please explain the necessity of this to me. I see this as a simple transfer from your banking institution to my banking institution. I routinely make large transfers between countries and I have never heard of having to open an account with a correspondent bank.

4. Company handling fees and insurance - Please quantify these 'handling fees', i.e., how much are we talking here? And this insurance you mention is for what?

I look forward to your earliest response.

Sincerely, 
Lewis D. Noogie

messages.body:
January 4, 2006

Felix,

Relax, there's nothing to worry about. I'm in touch with the bank and getting everything sorted out with them. Actually, this is working out better than I anticipated; they want me to come to their offices in Amsterdam and I need to go there anyhow. I will be spending a couple of weeks with the management of the hotel Krasnopolsky to help them prepare for the imminent return of some distinguished guests from the Foreign Office.

So we're very close my friend, and at he moment I only see one very minor obstacle to clear before we finish this project. The bank is requiring that I pay 9,763.6 Euros to finalize the transaction. This is quite alot of money but as I have always told you I'm willing to do it to help you out. However, my conditions have not changed. Before I invest my money into this venture, I still want you to send me a picture of yourself with holding a can of beer, smoking a cigarette, and with a woman sitting on your lap. I have to be certain that you have abandoned this idea that you have to spend all your time praying with pastors and stuff like that. I want to know that the person coming here to live with me is into the manly arts of drinking, smoking, chasing women.and generally living the good life.

Think of the fun we'll have, Felix. Out every night, loose women in and out at all hours, hangovers - sounds great, doesn't it? And don't forget Oxnard. She's still very interested in making your arrival here, uh, interesting!

Send me the picture and let's get this finished. I will be making my travel arrangements to Amsterdam this week so get it to me quickly.

Waiting to hear from you. 
Lewd

Felix,  my friend,

Listen, I just want to give you a heads-up. I got an email from that lady in Amsterdam, Anet Graham. She doesn't write very clearly sometimes but it sounds like if you don't get somebody here quickly to pick up your money that there could be a real problem. She said something about it had overstayed, I don't know, but it sounds like a problem to me.

Have you found someone to help you with this? If you haven't you'd better get moving on it, or come here to get it yourself.

My work here in Amsterdam is taking longer than I thought and it looks like I'm going to be staying here longer than I anticipated. I do so much enjoy this city - the canals, the architecture, the window shopping in the red light district.

Gotta get back to work. You better get on top of this situation Felix. I'd hate to see you have anymore problems with your money.

Lewd

Felix, my friend, how good to hear from you. How is everything with you? I was just about to write to you to see how things are going and to see if you had found another partner. It sounds like you haven't.

Felix,  I'm afraid I can't help you with this as much as I would like to and we both know why. As I have told you many times before I don't believe you are sincere about your change of lifestyle and I don't see any real interest from you in retrieving this money and coming to live in Russia. I don't like to be harsh with you my young friend, but you really need to take some initiative here to claim your father's money. If your father knew how you had someone who was ready and willing to help you and you blew it over something as simple as a picture, he'd be spinning in his grave like a lathe.

Look, I don't know how you originally found me but the best advice I can give you is to try and find someone else the same way. I'm sure there are all kinds of people out there who would be willing to help a bright young lad like yourself.

I have grown fond of you in the short time I've known you and I am very interested in how this all turns out. Please do stay in touch.

Your friend, 
Lewd

I'm sorry to hear that you consider exchange of mail with me as a 'waste of you precious time'. It did not seem that I was asking you to overexert yourself by asking you to have Peter Dunga contact me.

As I cannot in good conscience collect Felix's estate without his younger brother's knowledge and you don't want to waste your precious time to ask him to contact me, I will trouble you no longer.

I would point out that your refusal to contact Peter Dunga, Felix's rightful next of kin, is preventing him from pursuing a better life and I find this to be highly unethical of you.

I thank you for your assistance to date.

Lewis D. Noogie

messages.body:
June 9, 2006

Peter, so good to finally hear from you! Let me say first that I am so sorry about your brother Felix's premature death. I liked him very much and considered him to be a close friend. I was so saddened that things didn't work out between us and in a small way I feel responsible for his death. If he had been here he might still be with us.

Felix did not tell me anything about you, only that he had a younger brother. Please tell me a little about yourself - are you in school? What do you study? How old are you? Does Felix have any other surviving relatives? Who has been taking care of you?

I don't know how much Felix told you about the money your father left to the two of you, but you are a very rich man. We have to decide the best way to go about recovering these funds so that you can start living a better life.

I have many things to tell you but we have time to get to know one another. My number here is ¥ (095) xxx-xxxx. Please call or write anytime.

Sincerely, 
Lewd

messages.body:
June 9, 2006

Peter, my young friend, good to hear from you again. We have so much to discuss.

I'm very happy to hear that you study engineering. I myself received an engineering degree from a very prestigious correspondence university in Guatemala. It is one of my favorite degrees, although I don't have much use for it as an international hotel consultant. We also have excellent engineering schools here in Russia and I would like you to consider completing your education here.

The first thing I want you to understand is that I want to help you as I wanted to help your brother Felix.  If you let me handle the money end of it we can do this very quickly. I want you to keep in mind that I was given power-of-attorney from Felix and that I could have gone and claimed your money anytime after Felix died. Actually I could have even done it before he died, but I didn't. That money is legally yours and I'm going to help you get it. I have an excellent working relationship with Anet Graham with Goffin Group in Belgium where your money is being held.

If you follow my advice we'll get through this in no time.

Tell me what you think about what I said.

Your friend, 
Lewd

messages.body:
June 12, 2006

Peter, my young brother, I guess I owe you an apology but I wnat to explain this so you'll understand.

When I first became aquainted with Felix I was concerned that our lifestyles would be too incompatible for us to be able to live together. Felix was also religious and I tried to show him how to grow into a well-adjusted man. He told me he had changed but he was unwilling to prove it to me. I guess I suspected all along that he hadn't really changed at all.

Peter, I don't think it will work out between you and I either. If you came here you would no doubt want to spend all your time with some pastor talking about Sodomites and stuff like that. I'm sorry my friend, it just wouldn't work. I live life in the fast lane, on the edge, and once in awhile over the edge.

I will write to Goffin Group and relinquish my power of attorney over your inheritance. The way will be open for you to claim what is rigthfully yours. I truly wish you the best of luck and please stay in touch to let me know how everything goes.

Your brother, 
Lewd

Peter, my friend,

Sorry it took so long to get back to you but it's been a very busy week here at the hotel.

Well, It sounds like I have better material to work with in you than I had with your brother. So, you have a girlfriend and you like clubs. This is good news indeed.

Ok, as a first step to get you in better shape, I want you to try smoking. Cigarette or cigar, your choice. Just try it and let me know how you like it.

I wrote to Ms. Graham at Goffin Group to let her know I'll be arranging a trip there once you and I get the details of your arrival worked out.

Expecting to hear from you.

messages.body:
July 4, 2006

Peter,

So good to finally hear from you, you shouldn't wait so long to write.

I'm glad to hear you're feeling better but I knew it was nothing serious. That kind of thing has happened to me more times than I can remember. We all get carried away some times. I have to say I'm quite pleased with your progress and I can't wait to get you here so we can start partying in ernest. This is gonna be so much fun!

I'm trying to postpone some meetings I have next week so that I can get to Amsterdam to finish our business there. I've also been talking to my friend Boris in the Russian Immigration Department to get your visa started. We're very close, my friend, and I think this is all going to come together very quickly.

Peter, as I mentioned before, I have been quite pleased with your progress so far, much more so than I was with Felix's. He claimed he was trying all the things I told him to do but it turned out he wasn't. While you seem much more ernest, I have to remind myself that I'm going to have to turn over almost 9,800 Euros to complete this transaction and get you your money. I have to ask you a small favor, just to be sure that you're truly going to be the kind of person I can live with. I want you send me a picture of yourself, holding a beer and either a cigar or a cigarette, and with your girlfriend sitting on your lap. This might sound silly to you but it's important to me because I don't want to bring you here and find out that you're not at all into this kind of lifestyle. That would be the worst situation for both of us.

Ok, we both have work to do. I have to try and get those meetings cancelled and you have to get that picture to me. Please try and have it here in the next day or two.

So good talking with you again. 
Lewd

You complain about how difficult life is in Africa but you have done nothing to help yourself. It has been maddening trying to help first Felix and now you. You can't just sit back and expect someone else to do everything for you. You have to show some effort here.

I only want to see you succeed in life and I'm ready to help you do it. Talk to your lawyer, figure out what you want to do and then get back to me with your final decision.

messages.body:
September 2, 2006

Peter,

I was so glad to read your response and I can't tell you how pleased I am. You've made the right decision, my friend. I am so looking forward to bringing you here to Russia.

That said, I want you to think about a few things - you realize you will be coming to Russia, yes? It's a great place and it offers so much, but it is very different from what you are used to. We have some extremes in weather, from very hot to very cold. The food is not what you are familiar with. The customs are different. We're looking at some real culture shock here.

But the people are friendly, the vodka cold, and the women beautiful. And by the way, Oxnard is beside herself at the possibility of you coming here. In all honesty, I've never seen her this excited about anything.

So I want you to think this over and be absolutely sure of what you're doing before either of us make any further commitment. If you are sure you want to come here I can promise you a great adventure but I need to know that you are willing to take this chance.

Think about it and if your final answer is positive I will contact Goffin Group and make arrangements to have your brother's estate waiting for you when you arrive.

Lewd

Looking forward to seeing you here.

Lewd

messages.body:
September 9, 2006

Peter, my friend,

I'm happy to say that everything to finish this transaction with Goffin Group is in place. They still have to send me their office phone number and address but I'm expecting it any time now. I'm ready to send them what we owe them in charges. I guess the only thing remaining is for you to make a decision.

When I was working with your brother it was necessary for me to invest almost $3,500 of my own money for hotel living accomodations for a diplomat who never showed up. This was before Felix moved the money to Belgium. Goffin Group has informed me that I must now pay approximately 9,800 Euros, or about $12,000 in charges. I also probably need to send you some money to live in while we're getting everything finalized. I want to be very sure before I throw any more money at this thing.

When I first discovered that your brother was a very religious person I told him it would be best if he found someone else to help him. I explained that I could not function living with someone who sat around praying and meditating all day, talking about things like Samson being swallowed by a whale. When your brother told me he had changed and no longer had any interest in religion, I asked him to send me a picture of himself with a girl sitting on his lap and holding a beer and a cigarette. He refused to do so.

I suppose deep down I knew all along that he was lying when he said he had changed but it was his refusal to send me the picture that confirmed it. He was just too religious a person to be able to do something like that.

I feel more confident with you, but only a little. While Barrister Martins told me that you had indeed tried alcohol to the point of over-consumption, I also asked you for the same picture which you have not provided.

Peter my friend, I cannot take the chance of you coming here and not being able to fit in with the way I live. I don't want to go to all the effort to get you here and then have to send you back because we can't get along. I'm know you understand that I have to be reasonably confident that you're going to be able to adjust to my wild and crazy lifestyle.

So here's the deal - send me a picture of yourself, sitting, with a girl on your lap and a bottle of beer in one hand and a cigarette or cigar in the other. Just have a friend take the picture in your home or a club, it will cost you nothing. Seeing this picture will convince me of your character.

I must warn you - if you give me some bogus excuse like you're afraid the picture will end up in a newspaper or on the internet, our deal is off. Nobody but me is interested in this picture.

If you tell me you don't know anyone with a camera, our deal is off. Everybody owns a camera.

If you tell me you can't find a girl to sit on your lap, our deal is off. You're a rich man, any girl would be happy to sit on your lap for a picture.

Bottom line, if you give me any excuse as to why you can't send me the picture I ask for, I will know you are not sincere and our deal is off.

This is a small thing I ask but it will prove so much to me. Please don't dissappoint me. Send me the picture and your whole life changes. Goffin Group will receive their money the same day I receive the picture. I will send you enough money to live on until we get your brother's estate in hand and I get your Russian visa arranged. Once we get you here with your money, you will live as a wealthy man. You'll have girlfriends, parties, and girlfriends! And parties!

I want you to have a good start in life and I am the guy to give it to you. It's all up to you.

Let me know. 
Lewd







scamorama main street 
* 
get booked 
*
